question.text: Which of the following acts is not a part of the 'Evil Quartet'?

options.text: Shifting endangered species out of their natural habitat to special setting
Introduction of Nile perch which led to the destruction of species of cichlid fish
Extinction of passenger pigeon led to extinction of its parasitic bird lice

solution.text: Evil Quartet is four major causes of biodiversity loss which include: Habitat loss and fragmentation, over-exploitation of natural resources by humans example: rainforests destroyed for cultivation. Alien species invasion-example: introduction of Nile perch led to the destruction of species of cichlid fish. Co-extinctions, for example, co-extinction of the passenger pigeon and it's parasitic bird lice Columbicola extinctus and Campanulotes defectus. Shifting endangered species out of their natural habitat to a special setting is a type of ex situ conservation.
